top_comment.text:
*Talking about Creativity* - *Have you ever seen somebody play a Carrot?*
My mind - trained as a classical musician - could never have conceived such 
an idea - but voilà it works.
Enjoy the 5 minutes watching the transformation of a carrot into a musical 
instrument - and maybe you will look with more respect on the next carrot 
you will peel and chop!
#music   #musicalinstruments  
#creativity   #transformation  

+Katrina Pfannkuch +Lisa Engles +Kate Barbour +Sue Aston ﻿

top_comment.text:
This Guy Makes and Plays a Mean Carrot Clarinet

I tooted a saxophone in high school, and this made me hoot with laughter and admiration. Anyone who can build a carrot clarinet on stage and then make impressive music with it deserves all the video views he can get.

Hat tip to +Doug Alder and +Michael Ringland. 

#music #clarinet
top_comment.author: Jeff Posey

comments.text:
+Nicky Ringland If you come across a video of anyone making a saxophone 
from a turnip, please let me know. And yes, as +Michael Ringland says, fun 
stuff like this goes everywhere!
comments.author: Jeff Posey

comments.text: See +Nicky Ringland spread the love and it goes everywhere !!
comments.author: Michael Ringland

top_comment.text:
Creativity - the putting together of two previously unrelated things

There are maybe two no more dissimilar things than a carrot and saxophone mouthpiece, but yet one extremely creative individual shows us just how these two things relate.

Who knew you could make a carrot clarinet?

h/t +Lena Sinclaire

#creativity #music

You can make one out of wood with barely any extra effort. People are 
amazed by the most trivial stuff.

Now if he made the mouthpiece and reed out of a carrot... THAT would be

top_comment.author: jezuzfreek777

comments.text:
+Antonio Scotti
Man, you people are hilarious. "Poor old you..." and "need half a brain". 
It's "poor old you all." If you're amused by this, you need to see these 
Mattel machines that make animal sounds when you push the pictures.
comments.author: dobb673

comments.text:
+Bevin Chu
he would need half a brain and a constructive mind to even understand the 
point, let alone apply it
comments.author: Antonio Scotti

comments.text:
+dobb673 +jezuzfreek777 

For fuck sake, the guy spent a couple of minutes on a stage doing something 
interesting/original. It was a good setup to a neat punchline, nothing 
more. I'm sure the guy isn't selling do it yourself carrot kits online, he 
just came up with a neat idea that people took pleasure in. What bothers 
you guys is how amazed many people are as they don't understand the 
inner-workings of the instrument, but so the fuck what, why can't you just 
let people be amazed, smile to yourselves, shake your heads, and go on your 
merry way? The answer to that is rhetorical by the way.
comments.author: jjjmethosjjj

comments.text:
The carrot and the humour involved amazes people. Using wood wouldn't get 2 
million hits!
comments.author: Fred Spek

comments.text:
+Bevin Chu
It goes totally under my head. IMO, being creative is not taking something 
that's been refined and near-perfected for centuries and making a primitive 
facsimile of it. I also think one can "free up their mind" and have "the 
freedom to be more creative" when they are free of any thoughts of building 
the instrument, thus using their entire mind to compose music. I can see 
this as something like "how the first clarinet was made", but nothing 
beyond that.
comments.author: dobb673

comments.text: He did not drill into his hand so I am impressed.
comments.author: Sue Mitchel-Runow

comments.text: +dobb673 Good for you buddy!!!!!!!!!!!!
comments.author: thechangingman8

comments.text:
+thechangingman8
Knock yourself out. I'll be doing something useful.
comments.author: dobb673

comments.text: Gotta make the reed with a reed, harvested from the neighbourhood swamp.
comments.author: John Pierre LeBlanc

comments.text:
+dobb673 Poor old you. Let me play you a tune on my tiny violin made out of 
a cucumber.
comments.author: thechangingman8

comments.text: Exactly. Round box with holes in it on the right place ... so?
comments.author: Terrier Bram

comments.text:
+thechangingman8
Sometimes there is, when it's simply a waste of the time and effort of so 
many.
comments.author: dobb673

comments.text:
@jezuzfreek

Man, you totally missed his point! I hate to say it, but his lesson, which 
others got, apparently went right over your head.

His point was that understanding what the minimal requirements are for 
something to work can be psychologically liberating, and allow one the 
freedom to be more creative.

It had nothing to do with wood being more "practical." It was merely an 
exercise to free up one's mind.
comments.author: Bevin Chu

comments.text: Well there's no need to be a dick about it, is there?
comments.author: thechangingman8

top_comment.text:
This is on par with claiming you can make a speaker out of an apple, and 
then hollowing out an apple and putting an existing speaker in there. 

If he blew on the carrot without the reed it wouldn't do a thing. It's the 
reed that produces the sound, not the carrot. 

Nothing about this is really impressive... ﻿
top_comment.author: spiznas

comments.text:
+coosbay sailor Sorry, I didn't mean to refer to you. I totally agree with 
you that spiznas is being a bit ungrateful, so he's the one I was talking 
about (though he's not entirely wrong).

My point was that you shouldn't think of him, or anyone who complains in 
Youtube comments, as representative of all musicians.

Also, you're weird. I like that. Stay weird, man.
comments.author: Nathaniel Saxe

comments.text:
Thank you for your clear perspective. ...must admit, you got me there.  
There I am, wallowing in the pig pen slugging it out with the rest of 'em 
thinking I have found some worthwhile purpose in life, fighting for some 
cause: Finding joy in a carrot.

Sorry SPIZNAS, LazerJ, and Andrew for being so disagreeable; I should have 
know better.
comments.author: coosbay sailor

comments.text:
+coosbay sailor Nah, you're thinking of people who argue in youtube 
comments.
comments.author: Nathaniel Saxe

comments.text:
Spiznas: is it just musicians who are so ungrateful, self-absorbed and 
cynical that they can find no joy in life?
comments.author: coosbay sailor

comments.text:
Blow on a reed without the carrot. You get a duck whistle. Put a carrot in 
it, it produces beautiful sound. It amazes people, so it is completely 
normal to be impressed by it.

snazzy feel.  That is a lot hard to do than he makes it look.  I never can 
drill a straight hole :P﻿

captions.text:
There's a lot of people here. It must be 
because I'm wearing my red shirt.
and I'm going to give you

on how to make your own 
clarinet from a carrot.

A really good definition 
that I like of creativity

-- objects or ideas -- 
in creating something new.
So I'm going to take a carrot

And I'm going to give you 
a very quick demonstration
on how to make your own instrument.

Because I think the thing 
we forget is we tend --

crazy, because music 
is such a communal activity --

but we tend to leave music 
in the hands of the experts,
and we, all of us, consume music.
So, you need a kitchen knife.

I'm going to cut off 
the end of the carrot.

And I do have my trusty 
carrot clarinet measuring stick here,

which is giving me 
all my measurements.

But you can actually go to YouTube. 
I've put all measurements up on YouTube.

You just need to type in: 
"make your own carrot clarinet".

So, these are my markings 
for 6 finger holes down the front.
I'm just using the tip of this 12mm bit.

I'm giving you some... 
You don't even have to go to Youtube.

You see, you've got just to remember that. 
You can make a mark in your app.
and 1 thumb hole on the back.
Marking... Okay, now the tricky part.

so I don't make 
too much a mess of this stage.
So, you're laughing, and I understand.

So, that's for the finger holes. 
Let's do the thumb hole first.

And now the 6 finger holes 
that you noticed that I've marked.

You do need -- I'm actually using 
a saxophone mouthpiece, I mentioned,

but it's still a clarinet because of 
its cylindrical bore,

Ah...Sorry we've run out of time, 
I have to go...
